## Purpose
Core token system for Pygments syntax highlighter. Defines a hierarchical token type system using a custom tuple-based class that enables dynamic attribute access and parent-child relationships for syntax element classification.

## Key Classes

**_TokenType (L12-53)**: Custom tuple subclass implementing a hierarchical token system
- `split()` (L15-22): Returns path from root to current token as list
- `__init__()` (L24-26): Initializes subtypes set for tracking children
- `__contains__()` (L28-32): Implements containment check for subtype relationships
- `__getattr__()` (L34-41): Dynamic token creation via attribute access (uppercase names only)
- `__repr__()` (L43-44): String representation as dot-notation path
- `__copy__/__deepcopy__()` (L46-52): Singleton behavior preservation

## Key Functions

**is_token_subtype()** (L85-91): Legacy compatibility function for subtype checking
**string_to_tokentype()** (L94-117): Converts dot-notation strings to token objects

## Token Hierarchy
- **Root Token** (L55): Base `_TokenType()` instance
- **Special Tokens** (L57-63): Text, Whitespace, Escape, Error, Other
- **Source Code Tokens** (L65-73): Keyword, Name, Literal, String, Number, Punctuation, Operator, Comment
- **Generic Tokens** (L75-76): For non-source content
- **Aliases** (L80-82): Direct Token access shortcuts

## Architecture Patterns
- **Dynamic Token Creation**: Uppercase attribute access creates new subtypes automatically
- **Singleton Pattern**: Copy methods ensure token identity preservation  
- **Hierarchical Containment**: Parent tokens contain all their subtypes
- **Lazy Initialization**: Tokens created on first access and cached

## Critical Data Structure
**STANDARD_TYPES** (L123-214): Comprehensive mapping of token types to CSS class suffixes, covering:
- Keywords (k, kc, kd, kn, kp, kr, kt)
- Names (n, na, nb, bp, nc, no, nd, ni, ne, nf, fm, py, nl, nn, nx, nt, nv, vc, vg, vi, vm)  
- Literals (l, ld), Strings (s, sa, sb, sc, dl, sd, s2, se, sh, si, sx, sr, s1, ss)
- Numbers (m, mb, mf, mh, mi, il, mo)
- Operators (o, ow), Punctuation (p, pm)
- Comments (c, ch, cm, cp, cpf, c1, cs)
- Generic (g, gd, ge, gr, gh, gi, go, gp, gs, gu, ges, gt)

## Dependencies
Pure Python implementation using only built-in tuple and set types.

## Invariants
- Token instances are singletons
- Uppercase attribute names create new token subtypes
- Parent-child relationships are bidirectional (parent reference + subtypes set)
- All tokens inherit from base Token instance
